result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen P Carmody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 3 plus court appointed attorney fees due DOOR COUNTY.  Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action on Cts. 2 & 4 plus court appointed attorney fees due DOOR COUNTY. Cash bond applied. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No violent contact with the victims.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution, if any is requested, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted and sentence can be served in Brown County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen P Carmody

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Allen P Carmody
Current: 1764 Keehan Lane, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2017)
Prior: 1170 Sandra Ln, Green Bay, WI 54304
from defendant requesting early discharge from probation. Court responds: early discharge request up to DOC (w/DA having something to say about it) DTE
from Court to DOC Financial Program Supervisor re: DNA surcharge.
from DOC Financial Program Supervisor Jade Alegre questions DNA surcharge.
Court apptd atty bill from Steve Johnson. Court approves bill.

Defendant Allen P Carmody in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 2, 3 & 4. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2, 3 & 4.  Court dismisses Cts. 1, 5 & 6 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes for his actions. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense Discovery Demand
Court appoints Atty Steve Johnson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $75 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 7/15/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Clerk LS advised defendant by phone that court was lifting the no contact privision of his bond and that amendment would not go into effect until he stopped to sign a new bond. Defendant indicated he would stop before the end of the week to sign amended bond.
Court lifts no contact with A.C. or his residence.
No contact modification request completed by HELP of Door County with victim. State has no preference or input to bond modification. Court revises bond, lifts no contact with A.C..
from Atty Devin Shanley requesting copy of criminal complaint.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defendant asks court to change no contact to no violent contact with A.C.  State advises victim requested the no contact, indicates victim would need to go through program at HELP of Door County before they would agree to a bond modification. Bond remains in effect as is.

Defendant Allen P Carmody in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates defendant no longer qualifies for PD representation as he was able to retain his job after his bond was posted. Court advises defendant of options regarding representation. Defendant would like time to decide how he wishes to proceed regarding representation.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:00 am.
by Rose Carmody
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/14/15)
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Allen P Carmody in court, in custody along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with A.C., residence at 5618 W. Carlsville Road except on call to reach mother to attempt to raise bond.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Allen P Carmody appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
